doc.after: A showcase of the rather complex problems of scientific information and its interaction with lay persons is Brian Wynne s study of Sheepfarming in Cumbria after the Chernobyl disaster 1 25 He elaborated on the responses of sheep farmers in Cumbria who had been subjected to administrative restrictions because of radioactive contamination allegedly caused by the nuclear accident at Chernobyl in 1986 25 The sheep farmers suffered economic losses and their resistance against the regulation imposed was being deemed irrational and not adequate 25 It turned out that the source of radioactivity was actually the Sellafield nuclear reprocessing complex thus the experts who were responsible for the duration of the restrictions were completely mistaken 25 The example lead to various attempts to better involve local knowledge and experience of lay people and to assess its often highly geographically and historically defined background 26
